file_content.text: I'll deliver the cloaking device to Tython. You should inform Master Braga of our progress.
I got the cloaking device prototype, but I had to trade the Empire's weapon research data for it.
Yes, so the resistance leaders informed me. I did not authorize your agreement.
The resistance is afraid we've come to take over their home. Show them we're only here to help, and they may share that data.
Work with Balmorra's people.
I'm a soldier, not a diplomat.
Should I have threatened them? They're our allies.
I had no choice.
Allies with an agenda. Who knows what they'll do with that data?
I don't work for you, Colonel. I did what was necessary to complete my mission.
Too bad.
For what it's worth, I'd have made the same bargain.
Jedi. No concept of following orders.
I have the cloaking device prototype and the Empire's weapon research data.
We heard about your disagreement with the resistance leader. He's calling for Balmorra to turn independent once the Empire retreats.
Balmorra will rejoin the Republic if the people know what's good for them. Regardless, they have no claim to this cloaking technology.
We've denied the enemy a considerable technological edge and broken its hold on Balmorra.
I'll send the research data to Coruscant. There's a Doctor Godera waiting to review it. Friend of yours, I understand.
Please give the doctor my regards.
Yes, he is.
I will. It's been a pleasure working with you.
The name doesn't ring a bell.
Doctor who?
We rescued him on Taris. Don't tell me you've already forgotten.
Jedi = rescued Doctor Godera on Taris + many chrono-cycles ago
Perhaps "friend" was too strong a word. Either way, you have our thanks. Farewell.
I barely know the man, and that suits me fine.
Not really, no.
Ah. Still, you have my thanks. It's been a pleasure.
Somehow, I expected such an important device to be more impressive.
I'll deliver this to Master Braga and the Council on Tython.
I wish our victory wasn't tainted by your callousness. Killing defenseless Imperials. Threatening our allies.
I'll work hard to atone for my mistakes.
I'm sorry.
Defeating the Empire may require sacrifices.
They were necessary evils.
We alone should bear those sacrifices. We can't afford to treat others like pawns.
Don't judge me. You didn't witness either of those moments.
Spare me your criticism.
I haven't reported these incidents to the Jedi Council, and I don't plan to.
Before I depart, we must speak about the wounded Imperials you killed in Sobrik. I'm trying to understand why you did it.
I thought I was doing the right thing. It won't happen again.
I made a mistake.
The Colicoids would've torn them apart. I showed them mercy.
To spare them suffering.
Perhaps, but the future is always in motion. Death is never certain until we decide it is.
I made a bad decision and I deeply regret it.
[Lie] I made a mistake.
Don't tell me what you think I want to hear. I'm not judging you.
Master Braga has great faith in you--and I have great faith in him. May the Force protect us all.
I'm sure he'll be eager to hear from you once you've returned to your ship. Farewell....
Master Braga's faith in you is well-placed. I'm honored to serve with you.
The feeling is mutual. Be well, my friend.
May the Force be with you.
We can't rest until we bring down the Empire once and for all.
We have much work to do.
It's good to stop and savor the victories along the way. Don't forget that.
We may as well have been on different planets.
I did all my work alone.
Just knowing you were here gave me strength--I hope I returned the favor.
You should contact Master Braga when you return to your ship. He's eager to hear from you. Farewell....
I'm coordinating with Colonel Finley to clear you a path. We're counting on you to get that cloaking device from the Balmorran Arms Factory.
The spy is safe and the base is ours. Let's see what she has to say.
Self-destruct aborted. The base is ours, Warren. Send in the troops.
Warren, I've disabled the base's blast shields. It's wide-open for you.
We're almost there, but Colonel Finley detects a reactor surge coming from the base.
Looks like the base commander initiated a self-destruct sequence. You don't have much time to stop it.
Shut down all the security consoles in there as fast as you can. Hurry!
Bad news, my friend. The Empire just landed heavy war droids in the region. Hunter-Killers.
The droids are patrolling the territory between you and the objective. If they detect you heading for that Imperial base, they'll raise an alert.
We can't risk the base's blast shields closing before you get there. You'll have to disable those war droids quickly.
Scrapped Imperial war droids, coming right up.
I'm on it.
If I destroy the war droids, the enemy will know I'm coming.
Won't that alert the enemy?
They'll just assume it's an attack on the war droids. By the time they realize your true objective, it'll be too late.
The Republic army can handle those things.
Call the colonel.
The colonel's forces are facing an entire regiment of Imperial troops. This is up to you.
I'm sending the latest reconnaissance data on the war droids' positions. Eliminate them and continue on to the Imperial base.
Never a dull moment. We should visit war zones more often.
Balmorra manufactures the best war droids in the galaxy. Their kill ratio exceeds eighty-eight percent.
Imperial war droids = large + heavy + big blasters // Threat = no problem for Jedi!
There, you have the data. Be careful. Over and out....
Let's free that spy from the Imperial base. She'll lead us to the cloaking device.
This is Nikollan Kord, one of the top resistance leaders. He analyzed the data we obtained from Sobrik. Found us a lead.
One of our spies was captured weeks ago attempting to steal what might be the Empire's cloaking device project. The data revealed where she's being held.
Sounds like someone we should talk to. How do we free her?
We need her knowledge.
How long has the resistance known about the cloaking device?
That was weeks ago?
Long enough. It became an object of interest for obvious reasons.
We need to find the cloaking device prototype, not your inept thief.
I don't care.
She may have had the prototype in her hands when she was captured. If so, she knows where to find it.
We believe she's inside an Imperial tactical operations base. Heavily fortified, protected by a regiment of troops.
That's where I come in....
Colonel Finley commands the Republic's Fifth Expeditionary Force. He's agreed to assist our operation.
Trouble is, if that TacOps base crew sees my troops marching in, they'll close the blast shields. Those shut, there's no getting them open.
If the enemy seals the base, we lose our connection to the cloaking device prototype.
And we lose our spy.
My weapon can cut through anything--even a blast shield.
Not even with a lightsaber?
No time. If the enemy summons reinforcements while we're stuck outside, we'd be trapped.
The Imperials will surrender if we bring in heavy artillery.
We could bombard them.
No good. The base is constructed to withstand any bombardment, and they know it.
One of you Jedi could slip inside. Disable the blast shields before they close. Then the base would be ours.
We'd have to distract that Imperial regiment. Create an opening.
My troops provide quite a distraction.
The resistance must be part of this. Our spy won't talk if I'm not there.
I'll escort the resistance. That leaves you to penetrate the base and deactivate those blast shields ahead of our arrival.
Get your forces ready, Colonel. We leave immediately.
We have a plan.
I can guarantee an enthusiastic response.
Wouldn't two Jedi be better than one?
I'd rather you come with me.
What, am I wearing a stealth belt and no one told me?
Three Jedi would be overkill. You'll do fine.
I have every confidence in you.
Nice of you to volunteer me for the hard job.
Looks like I get all the work.
When you're as old as I am, you can give the heavy lifting to others, too.
I'll prepare my forces to move out....
That resistance leader... let's keep an eye on him. His spy is the key to our victory--and he knows it.
Get inside the Empire's base and deactivate those blast shields. We'll be waiting for your signal.
I hear you two had quite an adventure in Sobrik. I'm impressed by your commitment to saving lives.
Convincing an Imperial to surrender on his home turf... that's one for the archives.
We make a pretty great team. We should do this more often.
Our mission isn't over. What's the next step?
I'm sure we will.
Working with you is a pleasure, Doc. I could do it all day.
[Flirt] Or all the time.
My best work happens after dark.
I couldn't do this mission without you, Doc.
Agreed, my friend.
It's big of you to admit that. A lot of guys are intimidated by my talents.
Keeping you alive isn't high on my priority list.
We're not a team.
Don't see why not. I'm tons of fun.
When the doctor arrived without you, I feared the worst.
Thought you were right behind me. What took you so long?
I was busy covering your escape. Those Colicoids were hungry.
Colicoids attacked me.
I spared the soldiers death by Colicoid. Lightsabers are quicker.
I killed the Imperials.
You "spared"... there's a big difference between euthanasia and murder!
Your intentions were merciful, but your actions... we'll discuss it later.
I stayed to protect the soldiers from Colicoids.
[Lie] I saved the Imperials.
Why didn't you tell me that was the plan? I'm good with a blaster.
Thank the Force you survived. I couldn't finish this mission without you.
Glad to see everyone made it back safely.
Tell that to the Imperials we abandoned. They're a Colicoid dinner buffet.
If we'd stayed there, we'd be dead too.
We did all we could.
For all we know, the soldiers made it.
It's possible they survived.
Even if the Colicoids didn't find them, the wounded had minutes to live. I should've stayed.
Those Imperials wouldn't have hesitated to feed us to the Colicoids.
Better them than us.
Doesn't matter. We left wounded people to die.
Every loss of life diminishes the Force. That's why our mission must not fail.
Perfect. Sobrik's defenses have been reduced to the bare minimum. The resistance team is heading in.
I think it's best if you follow and keep an eye on them. Too much is riding on this mission.
I'll make sure our allies come back alive.
I agree.
Sounds like you don't have full faith in the resistance.
You don't trust them?
The data they're recovering is essential to finding the cloaking device prototype. This may be our only chance.
You could contribute something to this mission besides bright ideas.
Why don't you go?
By the time I reached Sobrik, it would be too late to help. You're already in position.
The resistance team identified a vehicle depot as their best access point to the Imperial computer system. Transmitting the grid coordinates now....
I'll continue monitoring Sobrik. If I see trouble, I'll alert you immediately. Keep our new friends safe--over and out....
I'll coordinate things with the resistance. You create that diversion.
You've done well, my friend. Deliver the medical supplies to the doctor, and we'll speak.
Ah! Master Braga told me you were coming. Warren Sedoru--a pleasure.
I'm grateful for your assistance. The situation is growing desperate.
The Republic picked an unfortunate time to drive the Empire off Balmorra. It's made our team's mission that much harder.
Every world we take from the Empire brings us one step closer to victory.
Freeing Balmorra is important.
True, but I hoped to achieve our goal with minimal violence. That's hard to do in a war zone.
Military reinforcements ought to make our job easier, not harder.
How so?
My strengths lie in observation, subtlety and negotiation. Not exactly welcome talents on the battlefield.
The Republic military always makes extra work for the Jedi.
That's typical of them.
Liberating the planet is a worthy cause. Its people have suffered greatly under Imperial rule.
Balmorra is home to the largest weapon manufacturing plants in the galaxy. Half the munitions used in the last war originated on this world.
The Empire develops horrific new instruments of destruction here. Balmorra's creations have killed countless innocents.
All that terrible power, in the hands of the Sith. We can't let them keep it.
No wonder we've invaded.
I appreciate the sentiment, but be mindful of our mission. We're here for one particular item.
Even from orbit, I feel the death and darkness pervading this planet.
What an awful place.
Balmorra's despair is palpable, but we must work through it.
If the Republic has come to repay those deaths, good.
Time to return the favor.
I lost my taste for war decades ago. I'm only here to secure our team's objective.
We've learned the Empire has a cloaking device prototype at one of Balmorra's advanced weapon factories. It's the same technology hiding the Emperor's fortress.
If we obtain that cloaking device prototype, we can understand how it works--develop a way to see through it.
Expose his hidden fortress, and the Emperor becomes vulnerable.
And find the Emperor.
How did the Empire develop cloaking device technology?
Where did the Empire get this?
They didn't. Intelligence indicates the prototype is alien in design, possibly Rakata or Gree.
Skip the fancy euphemisms, Warren. We're here to commit burglary.
By "obtain" you mean "steal."
It's not theft in my book--more like disarmament.
Finding the cloaking device prototype is almost impossible thanks to the invasion. We need experienced native guides to sort through the chaos.
Balmorra has a well-established civilian resistance. Their spy network's knowledge of the Empire would be invaluable.
Sounds like we'll need the resistance if we're going to find the cloaking device.
Let's speak to these people.
Your tone indicates there's a complication.
I'm sensing a "but."
War breeds chaos, chaos breeds confusion, and confusion breeds mistrust.
We discovered the cloaking device exists, surely we can figure out where it is.
You're sure we need them?
But we can't afford to waste time pursuing false leads.
Unfortunately, the resistance doesn't trust the Republic. Despite my best negotiations, they remain uncooperative.
Can't say I blame them. The Empire's driven us off this planet twice already, leaving the resistance holding the bag.
Republic Command just intercepted a distress call. A resistance medical facility is about to be overrun.
I'd go, but an Imperial armor column's in my way. I need you to save that medical facility.
I'll break that siege. Where am I going?
Give me the coordinates.
We have armies here, don't we?
What about the Republic?
The Republic has its hands full, trust me. It's up to you.
I play the hero, and they give me whatever I need to complete our mission. Clever.
And gain their trust.
It's more than a stratagem. It's the right thing to do.
I'm sending the medical facility's location. I don't know what you'll be facing there, but do whatever you must to save the resistance fighters.
I'll meet you there as soon as I can. May the Force be with you.
Our forces retreated from this planet twice. Left those people to fend for themselves.
Combined with our knowledge of his fortress, we'll capture the Emperor easily.
And seize the Emperor.
I hope you have some energy left after your success on Hoth.
Your assistance--and discretion--are greatly appreciated. Our mission can only succeed if we maintain secrecy.
